Dictionary Information

Macrons (ā, ē, ī, ō, ū)
  1. Home
  2. Memoria Press Form 3
  3. Chapter 1

Chapter 1

Sort:

accuso, accusare, accusavī, accusatus
to accuse

derivatives: accusatory, accusative

adoro, adorare, adoravi, adoratus
to adore

derivatives: adorable, adoration

amo, amare, amavi, adoratus
to love, like

appareo, apparere, apparui, apparitus
to appear

derivative: apparition

appello, appellare, appellavi, appellatus
to address

derivative: appellate (court, jurisdiction)

ardeo, ardēre, arsi, arsus
to burn, be on fire

derivative: arson

aro, arare, aravi, aratus
to plow

caveo, cavēre, cavi, cautus
to beware of, guard against

derivative: caution

celo, celare, celavi, celatus
to hide

derivative: conceal

clamo, clamare, clamavi, clamatus
to shout

derivative: exclamatory

cras, , ,
tomorrow

derivative: procrastinate

creo, creare, creavi, creatus
to create

derivative: creation

culpo, culpare, culpavi, culpatus
to blame

debeo, debēre, debui, debitus
to owe, ought

derivative: debt, debit

delecto, delectare, delectavi, delectatus
to delight, please

derivative: delectable

demonstro, demonstrare, demonstravi, demonstratus
to show, point out

derivative: demonstration

do, dare, dedi, datus
to give

derivative: dative

doceo, docēre, docui, doctus
to teach

derivatives: doctor, doctorate

dubito, dubitare, dubitavi, dubitatus
to doubt

derivative: indubitably

erro, errare, erravi, erratus
to err, wander, be mistaken

exploro, explorare, exploravi, exploratus
to explore

derivative: exploratory

exspecto, explorare, exspectavi, exspectatus
to wait for, exspect

derivative: expectation

gaudeo, gaudēre, ---, ---
to rejoice

habeo, habēre, habui, habitus
to have

habito, habitare, habitavi, habitatus
to live, dwell, inhabit

heri, , ,
yesterday

hodie, , ,
today

iubeo, iubēre, iussi, iussus
to order

iudico, iudicare, iudicavi, iudicatus
to judge, consider

iuvo, iuvare, iuvi, iutus
to help

laboro, laborare, laboravi, laboratus
to work

derivatives: elaborate, laboratory

laudo, laudare, laudavi, laudatus
to praise

derivative: applaud

lavo, lavare, lavi, lautus
to wash

derivative: lavatory

libero, liberare, liberavi, liberatus
to free, set free

derivative: liberation

maneo, manēre, mansi, mansus
to stay, remain

derivative: mansion

moneo, monēre, monui, monitus
to warn

derivatives: admonish, admonition

moveo, movēre, movi, motus
to move

derivative: motion

muto, mutare, mutavi, mutatus
to change

derivative: mutation

narro, narrare, narravi, narratus
to tell

derivatives: narration, narrator, narrative

nato, natare, natavi, natatus
to swim

navigo, navigare, navigavi, navigatus
to sail

derivatives: navigation, navigate

nego, negare, negavi, negatus
to deny

derivatives: negate, negative

non, , ,
not

numquam, , ,
never

nunc, , ,
now

nuntio, nuntiare, nuntiavi, nuntiatus
to announce, report

occupo, occupare, occupavi, occupatus
to seize

derivatives: occupy, occupation

oppugno, oppugnare, oppugnavi, oppugnatus
to attack

opto, optare, optavi, optatus
to choose, desire, wish

oro, orare, oravi, oratus
to beg, pray

paro, parare, paravi, paratus
to prepare

perturbo, perturbare, perturbavi, perturbatus
to distrub

porto, portare, portavi, portatus
to carry

derivative: portable

pugno, pugnare, pugnavi, pugnatus
to fight

derivative: pugnacious

puto, putare, putavi, putatus
to think

derivative: computer

respondeo, respondēre, respondi, responsus
to reply, respond, answer

derivatives: respond, responsive

rogo, rogare, rogavi, rogatus
to ask

derivative: interrogative

saepe, , ,
often

saluto, salutare, salutavi, salutatus
to greet

derivative: salutations, salute

sedeo, sedēre, sedi, sessus
to sit

derivatives: sessile, sedentary

semper, , ,
always

servo, servare, servavi, servatus
to guard, keep

specto, spectare, spectavi, spectatus
to watch

spero, sperare, speravi, speratus
to hope

sto, stare, steti, status
to stand

derivative: station

supero, superare, superavi, superatus
to overcome, surpass

taceo, tacēre, tacui, tacitus
to be silent

derivative: tacit

tempto, temptare, temptavi, temptatus
to try

derivative: temptation

teneo, tenēre, tenui, tentus
to hold

derivatives: tenacity, tenacious

terreo, terrēre, terrui, territus
to frighten, scare

derivative: terrify

timeo, timēre, timui, ---
to fear, be scared of

derivative: timid

tum, , ,
then, at that time

umquam, , ,
ever

valeo, valēre, valui, ---
to be strong, be well

derivative: valedictorian

video, vidēre, vidi, visus
to see

derivative: vision

voco, vocare, vocavi, vocatus
to call

derivative: vocative

vulnero, vulnerare, vulneravi, vulneratus
to wound

derivative: vulnerable
